intro: Boehmeria cylindrica var. brachystachys, commonly known as narrow-stalked flax, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its slender, cylindrical stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces silky, white fibers in its stems, which have been historically used for textile purposes. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and traditional uses.
